Column Comment.0: SUPPORT FACILITY SUBTYPE: The type of support facility that is described by thisrow of data. These values are managed by check constraint, and may only be thename of a valid sub type of support facility.
Column Comment.1: RIG IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier assigned to the rig. Rigs may be drilling rigs orother kinds of service rigs assigned to a well site.
Column Comment.2: SHAKER IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the shaker.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: CAPACITY: the capacity of the equipment.
Column Comment.6: EQUIPMENT CATALOGUE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the list of kinds ofequipment. Think of this as a catalogue or brochure that shows all the kinds ofequipment that you may use, but may or may not actually have. Actual peices ofequipment that exist are defined in the table EQUIPMENT. Use this table to definethe make and model number of a piece of equipment without identifying the specificpiece of equipment.
Column Comment.7: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.8: EQUIPMENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a specific peice of equipment.
Column Comment.9: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.10: INPUT TYPE: The type of input into an electrical device. Usually measured in Watts.
Column Comment.11: INSTALL DATE: the date this piece of equipment was installed on the rig.
Column Comment.12: POSITION DESCRIPTION: Desctiption of the position of the shaker on the rig.
Column Comment.13: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.14: REFERENCE NUMBER: Referemce number for the BOP.
Column Comment.15: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.16: REMOVE DATE: The date that this piece of equipment was removed from the rig.
Column Comment.17: SHAKER COUNT: the number of blow out over shaker units of this type, described inthis row of data, on the rig.
Column Comment.18: SHAKER SIZE: The size of the shaker mesh.
Column Comment.19: SIZE DESCRIPTION. Textual description of the size of the mesh on the shaker.
Column Comment.21: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.22: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.23: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.24: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.25: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.26: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.27: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.28: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
